text:
Kirwin is a city in Phillips County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 171 people lived there.
History.
Kirwin was created in 1869. It was named after Col. John Kirwin, who led a stockade at the town place. Kirwin was incorporated as a city in 1880.
Kirwin was on the Missouri Pacific Railroad.
Geography.
Kirwin is at (39.672052, −99.121931). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. Of that, is land and is water.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 171 people, 87 households, and 42 families living in Kirwin.
Education.
Kirwin is a part of USD 110 Thunder Ridge schools in Kensington. The Thunder Ridge High School mascot is Thunder Ridge Longhorns.
Kirwin schools were closed because of school unification. The Kirwin High School mascot was Kirwin Wildcats.
